page.title: 14THE HAMSTER INN-HATHERDEN
page.content: The Hamster, formerly the Bluebell and the Bell and Crown, was built in the mid 16th century,and cost forty pounds.Until recently it had been run as a disco, but now it has been changed back to a family pub, with customers being local and from around the area. The landlord and his wife,Keith and Joan Deacon and their daughter Julie, who manages the pub, moved in in May.The Hamster offers a wide range of drinks and also now offers an extensive menu which includes special childrens meals.It is open seven days a week,from 11am until 11pm.It has at present an entertanments licence which allows it to stay open until 12 midnight. This is not generally used, but Mr. Deacon intends to put on occasional special entertainment and functions eg. Halloween Discos.
